constituent: jewel, king, jewel, ball, earring, drop
heisigComment: * As a primitive, we can use this to mean either jewel or ball. When it appears anywhere other than on the left side of a kanji, it takes the same shape as here. On the left, it will be lacking the final stroke, making it the same as the character in the previous frame.
heisigStory: Note the drop here in the king's scepter, which is exactly what you would expect it to be: a precious jewel handed down from of old as a symbol of his wealth and power.
koohiiStory1: The king is said to have only one family jewel below the belt...
koohiiStory2: The king is said to have only one family jewel below the belt...and he hangs left! (I always screw up the direction of the "drop").
myStory: trang sức. nhà vua đeo vòng
